  • Method Details

    • getConnection

      public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
      Gets a connection to the database. This is only for the use of other database classes, so I'm tempted to make it package-private; but the community seems to agree that package-private is not a good idea.
      Returns:
      a connection to the database

    • getPreparedStatement

      public java.sql.PreparedStatement getPreparedStatement​(java.lang.String sql, int flags)
      Gets a prepared statement. The prepared statement is tracked, and automatically closed during shutdown. If the statement needs to be closed prior to shutdown use surrenderPreparedStatement.
      Parameters:
      sql - the SQL command associated with the prepared statement.
      flags - Statement.RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS or Statement.NO_GENERATED_KEYS
      Returns:
      a prepared statement for connected to the database
      Throws:
      kcls_manager.main.KCLSException - if the operation fails

    • surrenderPreparedStatement

      public void surrenderPreparedStatement​(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement)
      Frees the resources associated with a prepared statement obtained via getPreparedStatement.. This method should only be used with prepared statements obtained via getPreparedStatement..
      Parameters:
      statement - the statement to surrender
      Throws:
      kcls_manager.main.KCLSException - if the operation fails
      See Also:
      getPreparedStatement(String, int)

    • truncateTable

      public void truncateTable​(java.lang.String listName)
      Delete all rows from a given table. This is probably only necessary during testing.
      Parameters:
      listName - the given table

    • insertComment

      public void insertComment​(kcls_manager.main.Comment comment)
      Add a new record to the COMMENTS table.
      Parameters:
      comment - the comment to add

    • updateComment

      public void updateComment​(kcls_manager.main.Comment comment)
      Update a given row in the COMMENTS table. The row must previously have been fetched, and the commentsID set.
      Parameters:
      comment - the given row

    • deleteComment

      public void deleteComment​(kcls_manager.main.Comment comment)
      Delete a given row in the COMMENTS table. The row must previously have been fetched, and the commentsID set.
      Parameters:
      comment - the given row

    • getComment

      public kcls_manager.main.Comment getComment​(int ident)
      Get a row from the comments table given the row's commentsID.
      Parameters:
      ident - the given commentsID
      Returns:
      the retrieved comment, or null if not found

    • getAllComments

      public java.util.List<kcls_manager.main.Comment> getAllComments()
      Get all comments from the COMMENTS table.
      Returns:
      a (possibly empty) list of all rows in the COMMENTS table

    • getCommentsFor

      public void getCommentsFor​(kcls_manager.main.Title title)
      Get all rows in the COMMENTS table that are associated with a given title. The retrieved comments are set in the given title object.
      Parameters:
      title - the given title object

    • getCommentsFor

      public void getCommentsFor​(kcls_manager.main.Author author)
      Get all rows in the COMMENTS table that are associated with a given author. The retrieved comments are set in the given author object.
      Parameters:
      author - the given title object

    • insertList

      public void insertList​(kcls_manager.main.KCLSList list)
      Add a new record to the LISTS table.
      Parameters:
      list - the list to add

    • getAllLists

      public java.util.List<kcls_manager.main.KCLSList> getAllLists()

    • getTitleLists

      public kcls_manager.main.KCLSList getList​(int ident)

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Shutdown the Derby embedded driver.

    • dumpTable

      public void dumpTable​(java.lang.String tableName)
      Dump the contents of a given table. Mainly used for diagnostic purposes.
      Parameters:
      tableName - the name of the given table
